alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 2:03PM CDT until March 26 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama and northwest Florida, including the following counties, in south central Alabama, Covington. In northwest Florida, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 203 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Andalusia, Opp, Florala, River Falls, Laurel Hill, Lockhart, Heath, Red Oak, Stanley, Huckaville, Carolina, Beda, Stedman, Beck, Green Bay, Sanford, Horn Hill, Falco, Wing and Onycha.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
